text: Les Main (26 November 1915 – 28 November 1998) was an Australian rules footballer who played with Collingwood in the Victorian Football League (VFL). Main became a coach after leaving Collingwood and had success in the Hampden Football League with Warrnambool, which he guided to premierships in 1946 and 1947. He spent the 1948 season as coach of New South Wales club Leeton, then returned to the Hampden Football League as coach of Terang for two years, before moving on to Noorat in 1951. == Notes == == External links == * *Profile on Collingwood Forever Category:1915 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Australian rules footballers from New South Wales Category:Collingwood Football Club players Category:Albury Football Club players Category:Warrnambool Football Club players Category:Warrnambool Football Club coaches Category:Terang Football Club players Category:Terang Football Club coaches
title: Les Main
